item.title: How to Install and Configure VNC on Ubuntu 20.04
item.author: Author
item.description:
Introduction

Virtual Network Computing, or VNC, is a connection system that allows you to use your keyboard and mouse to interact with a graphical desktop environment on a remote server. It makes managing files, software, and settings on a remote server easier for users who are not yet comfortable with the command line.

In this guide, you‚Äôll set up a VNC server with TightVNC on an Ubuntu 20.04 server and connect to it securely through an SSH tunnel. Then, you‚Äôll use a VNC client program on your local machine to interact with your server through a graphical desktop environment.
